intro: Bryonia sinuosa, commonly known as the wavy bryony, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy stems, often producing yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant produces orange-colored berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
